text: The Vienna Convention on the Law of Treaties is a contract of treaties and international law. It also defines the means of expression consent to be bound by a treaty including ratification. It was signed in the 1960s. It codified earlier customs that were there. 105 states signed the convention. == Other websites == *Full text of the treaty: html, pdf *Easy-to-read version of the text ==Sources== *Damrosch, Henkin, et al., International Law, West Group 2001. Category:Treaties and Conventions
title: Vienna Convention on the Law of Treaties
